result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara J Horton

records.addlTxt:
1:10 PM 2022CF000107, 2022CF000127, 2022CM000117, 2022CM000118 - Defendant Sara J Horton in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.

2022CM000117, 2022CM000118 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Dadoun waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea.

2022CF000107, 2022CF000127 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Dadoun waives the formal reading. Attorney Dadoun waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing. SH agrees with waiving the time limits of a preliminary hearing. 

Attorney Harper states that there is a motion to forfeit bond in all the cases except for 22CF127. Court sets a motion hearing re: forfeiting bond. Court sets motion hearing for 11/09/22 at 2:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM 22CM117, 22CM118, 22CF107, 22CF127 -  Defendant Sara J Horton in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Dadoun ask for another date due to just getting the complaint in 22CF127. Court resets.

Attorney Dadoun asks about the motion to forfeit bond. Attorney Harper states that the motion has been filed but doesn't believe that it can be done today before the conviction.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to Forfeit Cash Bond

3:05 PM 22CF107/ 22CM117/ 22CM118 - Defendant Sara J Horton in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton. Court goes over the documents.

Attorney Harper asks that the prior bond be reinstated. 

Attorney Dadoun asks for a reset to allow time to speak with her client.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:37 PM Defendant Sara J Horton not in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Sara J Horton.  Attorney Dadoun states that there was a voicemail asking for a date and time of her hearing. State asks for a warrant. Court orders a warrant.

Attorney Dadoun will need to call the public defenders office to get a hearing set for 08/18/22 if SH appears before getting pick up by law enforcement.
for Release of Seized Property
CANCELLED- Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

to Those Posting Cash Bond.

(one payment from SH and from JA)
No contact with RP.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:09 PM 22CM117, 22CM118, and 22CF107 - Defendant Sara J Horton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dadoun appears specially and asks for a dean appointment. 

01:31 PM - Same appearances. Court address the petition. SH sworn and testimony given. Attorney Dadoun states that she is willing to take this case. Court speaks about taking a loan out on her home to get an attorney. 

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Dadoun on all three cases.. Defendant to deposit $100/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 09/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court. 

Attorney Dadoun asks for time to speak with her client about the complaints. 

Attorney Dadoun state that her client can post a $500 bond. Attorney Harper objects to a bond modification. Court speaks about the current bond and will reduce bail to $1,000 cash bond on 22CF107.

Attorney Dadoun speaks about her clients cell phone. Court indicates that a motion should be filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
